column4: looks like i dropped in at the right moment - people discussing ati drivers
does anybody here have any info that's newer than november on dri2 support?
gnea: i'm getting frustrated with flickering, as i imagine a lot of people are ;)

gnea: indeed. i'm on a thinkpad w500. any opengl or windowed video flickers when i'm using compiz fusion. this seems to be a very, very common problem, since there aren't any ati drivers right now with dri2 support
gnea: but i haven't heard anything since november regarding this support. it seems like people just stopped talking about it.
I'm optimistic and assuming they stopped talking because they're coding
I have absolutely no evidence for this though. I just like being optimistic :)
i should hope so. i wish i knew more about linux drivers and ati's hardware so that i could contribute
aww, now you had me go to cgit.freedesktop.org and find no commits on the relevant branches (I think) since november :(
yeah that's why i've been miffed :(
so you think it's looking bad for dri2, eh?
I'm sort of in the same boat as you, wondering if I could learn enough about drivers in a sane amount of time to help this along
my thoughts exactly. too much going on with work right now to get into it though :'(
what graphics chipset are you running?
man, that's something that should be very well supported by now. i feel your pain
at first i thought it was just because i have a weird mobile card. firegl v5700
it works quite nicely as long as I don't try to do anything 3d-ish while compiz is compositing. google earth runs ok, compiz runs ok (including textured xv), just both at the same time breaks.
xscreensaver doesn't like to work correctly with compiz
yeah, same root issue probably, google earth was just the first 3d app I actually use that came to mind

from what i understand, since compiz is opengl any time another process tries to write to the buffer they collide and cause the flickering; somehow lack of dri2 disables a back buffer somewhere along the way...
what display resolution are you running? :P
native resolution of the TFT panel on this laptop
